intro: Cirsium vlassovianum var. album, commonly known as the white thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and large, showy white to pale purple flower heads. The plant produces numerous ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Cirsium. Its leaves are usually deeply lobed and covered in fine, white hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine environments.
